Thanks Sarah,
I will try that.
Regards,

Pankaj

  ----- Original Message -=
---- 
  From: Sarah Wustner 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday=
, September 05, 2001 6:58 PM
  Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message
=


  My group ran into something similar recently -- some people had built t=
heir code with JBuilder, and others had built with ant and the standard JDK=
.  We got odd errors when we tried to run code together that had been compi=
led differently.  Apparently, JBuilder uses its own internal JDK which is n=
ot 100% the same as the standard.  It would not surprise me if VisualCafe d=
id something similar.
   
  Your best bet is probably to standardize on one=
 or the other - either compile and run everything from inside of Visual Caf=
e, or use it only as your editor and instead use ant (or make, or whatever)=
 to build and run.

  -----Original Message-----
  From: David Roussel [mai=
lto:dir@...]
  Sent: Wednesday, September 05, 2001 6:28 AM
  To: jun=
it@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message


    Sorr=
y Pank I don't know the solution to you problem.  However I used to use Vis=
ualCafe 4 and now I have moved to Ant, Jikes and a text editor I suffer les=
s stress.
     
    -----Original Message-----
    From: Pankaj Solanki [ma=
ilto:psolanki@...]
    Sent: 05 September 2001 14:18
    To: junit@yaho=
ogroups.com
    Subject: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message


    Hi all,
     =

    Will any of you plz assess, why my SimpleTest.java file is failing :
 =
     
    The problem I am facing is:

    When I compile a junit test file=
 thru' VisualCafe4.0, it gets compiled without any error.
    Later while i=
nvoking the TestRunner utility from console (any approach - textui, awtui o=
r swingui),
    I am getting following error message:
     
    java.lang.I=
ncompatibleClassChangeError: junit.framework.Assert: method assert(Ljava/la=
ng/String;Z)V did not used to be static

     at junit.samples.SimpleTest.t=
estAdd(SimpleTest.java:32)
     
    But surprisingly if I compile the same=
 file from console and run the TestRunner utility then test passes without =
any error and it show a green bar. Perfect run.

    My VisualCafe4.0 setti=
ng is fine (junit.jar and the directory which contain this jar file is incl=
uded in the classpath of sc.ini file). 

    Thanks,

    Pankaj

unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
